alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 10:49AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOW AND RAIN POSSIBLE TO START FEBRUARY... Confidence has increased in a series of winter storms that will bring moderate to heavy snowfall to much of the Panhandle mid- week. While it is too early to determine amounts, significant snowfall accumulations are possible at sea level Tuesday night through Wednesday. Confidence falls regarding a second storm that arrives Thursday into Friday. There is still disagreement on whether the following system pulls sufficient warmer air to change precipitation to rain at sea level. While there is increasing confidence in a transition to rain by Thursday, scenarios we cannot discount still exist that would allow snow to persist. There is greater potential for moderate to heavy precipitation to arrive with the second storm Thursday into Friday, so any rain or snow that does fall, could be heavy and impactful. Looking beyond, the probability of warmer air and continuing periods of rain and wind grow stronger next weekend. Please monitor for updates as confidence in the forecast grows.
